newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice ends mixed, new crop up on weather fears.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice ends mixed, new crop up on weather fears.

text.p: CBOT rice futures ended a quiet session mixed on Tuesday with new crop months higher on concerns wet weather would hamper rice plantings in the U.S. south, traders said.
"We're still pretty concerned about weather delays," a trader said.
A rainy spring and heavy flooding left many fields too wet for planting.
Nearbys ended lower on small-lot technical selling.
Rice ended five cents per cwt lower to three cents higher with May off five at $11.60.
Volume was estimated by CBOT at 250 lots, compared with Monday's actual volume of 399 lots.
